io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi

Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi.NanoleafDevice
      • io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi.Canvas

  • public class Canvas
extends NanoleafDevice
    The Canvas class is one of the three main concrete classes for creating a NanoleafDevice. This class should only be used to connect to physical Canvas devices. For other devices such as the Aurora or Hexagons, use the Aurora and Shapes classes, respectively.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Canvas

        public Canvas(java.lang.String hostname,
              int port,
              java.lang.String accessToken)
       throws NanoleafException,
              java.io.IOException
        Creates a new instance of the Canvas controller.
        Parameters:
        hostname - the hostname of the controller
        port - the port of the controller (default=16021)
        accessToken - a unique authentication token
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • Canvas

        public Canvas(java.lang.String hostname,
              int port,
              java.lang.String accessToken,
              NanoleafCallback<Canvas> callback)
        Asynchronously creates a new instance of the Canvas.
        Parameters:
        hostname - the hostname of the Canvas
        port - the port of the Canvas (default=16021)
        accessToken - a unique authentication token
        callback - the callback that is called when the device has been initialized
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs
